value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Propagating filters using TREATAS in DAX
value.excerpt: How to create a virtual relationship in DAX using the TREATAS function. Article and download: https://sql.bi/41311/?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Understanding the difference between LASTDATE and MAX in DAX
value.excerpt: This video explains why in many cases, MAX should be used instead of LASTDATE to search for the last date in a time period using DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/673766?aff=yt

value.title: Using CONCATENATEX in DAX
value.excerpt: This video showcases the use of CONCATENATEX, a handy DAX function to return a list of values in a measure. Article and download: https://sql.bi/206871

value.title: Using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS in DAX
value.excerpt: Improve DAX queries by using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS when you create table expressions. Article and video: https://sql.bi/54337?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Using OR conditions between slicers in DAX
value.excerpt: How to implement a logical OR condition between two slicers of a Power BI report, or of a PivotTable in Excel. By default, when relying on more than one slicer they are considered in an AND condition. This video+article explains how to change this behavior using DAX.  Article and sample download: https://sql.bi/66373?aff=yt

value.title: Working below a DAX formula’s granularity
value.excerpt: How to control the result of a DAX measure used in a report with granularity below the granularity supported by the formula. Article and download: https://sql.bi/661463/?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: DAX Fridays! #11: Using variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables are an extremely useful feature in DAX, but perhaps not a well known one. Variables, 1. Make your formulas more readable 2. You can reuse them through your report 3. Can also be tables 4. Are more efficient  Download our Growth dashboard if you want to see the example live:http://curbal.com/blog/the-ultimate-dashboard-to-track-your-website-growth-with-google-analytics-and-power-bi-supercharged-excel

value.title: DAX Fridays! #14: SUMMARIZE

value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. value.title: DAX Fridays! #42: SUBSTITUTE (multiple values)
value.excerpt: In today's video, we will learn how to use the DAX function SUBSTITUTE.  Substitute changes text for another text. We will do two examples, how to substitute one value for another and how to substitute multiple values.
